alert.note: Alert for Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 28 at 8:18PM CDT until May 01 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 inches or more are possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Iron County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the northwestern area of the Lac du Flambeau Band. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A prolonged period of snow will be possible starting Saturday night. The snow may mix with or change to all rain during the daylight hours Sunday into Sunday evening with lower impacts. The snow is expected to be wet and heavy which could lead to significant impacts including breaking branches leading to sporadic power outages. Th snow belt region has the highest chance at seeing heavy snow. There is still quite a bit of uncertainty in forecast snow amounts so stay tuned for updates.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
